channel.title: Wild is safe
channel.description: Yesterday I messed up something with my funpk, so I fixed it. Today I fought someone in wild, (two regular players) and loser didn't drop anything. I tried reversing what I did to funpk, but funpk is still safe, and the entire wild is safe. I don't know what to do :s

item.title: Wild is safe
item.dc:creator: @mc_wobbla mc wobbla
item.description:
@mc_wobbla wrote:

Clawz fury:

Not this one. The one found in the process() method, it should be there because you are using Delta I believe? It should contain “Oh dear you have died” and all that crap. There are about 2-5 if statements. Post them all.

…The one time I forget to put in title. I’m using PI actually

item.title: Wild is safe
item.dc:creator: @mc_wobbla mc wobbla
item.description:
@mc_wobbla wrote:

Clawz fury:

post your death method

public void applyDead() {    
		c.getTradeAndDuel().stakedItems.clear();
		c.respawnTimer = 15;
		c.isDead = false;
		Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
		if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
			c.killerId = findKiller();
			if(o != null) {
				c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
				if(o.duelStatus == 5) {
					o.duelStatus++;
				}
				if (Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom != o.lastKilled && c.duelStatus == 0) {
					o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4);
					o.sendMessage("You recieved 4 pkPoints");
					o.lastKilled = Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom;
				} else {
					o.sendMessage("You do not recieve pk points because you have killed " +c.playerName+ " twice in a row.");
				}
			}
		}

Read full topic
